result.execSummary:
All charges against Ameerah Amber Stanley in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ameerah Amber Stanley is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ameerah Amber Stanley

defendant.name: Stanley, Ameerah Amber
defendant.address: 420 Cedar Street, Apt A8, Baldwin, WI 54002

records.addlTxt:
10:05 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for State of Wisconsin, Defendant Ameerah Amber Stanley in court, Attorney John P Bjork in court for Ameerah Amber Stanley. INCLUDES 22CM486 (INIT), 22CM179, 22CM206, 22CM270, 22CT29 and 22TR411. 22CM486 (INIT): Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands. PLEAS: Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 - Resisting or Obstructing an Officer in 22CM206 and Ct 1 - OWI 2nd in 22CT29. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 - Resisting or Obstructing an Officer in 22CM206 and Ct 1 - OWI 2nd in 22CT29. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Cts 2-5 in 22CM206, merge and dismisses Ct 2 in 22CT29 and cases 22CM179, 22CM270, 22CM486 and 22TR411 in their entirety. Sentencing arguments. 

Crt orders: 
22CM206
Ct 1 - Resisting or Obstructing an Officer
S/W 2 years probation with conditions:
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment. 
- Testing randomly and regularly by Agent
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol
- Maintain current mental health treatment and follow recommended treatment
- Letter of Apology to Officer
- Court Costs $243
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200
3 days jail credit against ultimate sentence

22CT29
Ct 1 - OWI 2nd
S/W 2 years probation with conditions:
- 5 days conditional jail - time served
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment. 
- Testing randomly and regularly by Agent
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol
- Maintain current mental health treatment and follow recommended treatment
- 16 months driver's license revocation
- 16 months IID
- Fine $1,492 inclusive of costs and surcharge
- Blood fee $139
- DNA Sample

Defendant to report to probation no later than 1:00 PM today.
Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation. 
Apply bond on file; any remaining balance to be refunded to payor. 
Adjourned. kma
